text: The European Junior Shooting Championships are the main shooting championships in Europe organize by European Shooting Confederation (ESC). ==European Junior Shooting Championships (25, 50, Running Target)== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=30|Number ! width=30|Year ! width=100|City ! width=150|Country ! width=30|Events ! width=200|Notes |- | align="center"|1||1984|| Vingsted|| || align="center"|8 || 25, 50 |- | align="center"|2||1986|| Budapest|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50 |- |- | align="center"|3||1988|| Joensuu|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|4||1990|| Zenica|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|5||1992|| Sofia|| || align="center"|8 || 25, 50 |- | align="center"|6||1994|| Wrocław|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|7||1996|| Sofia|| || align="center"|8 || 25, 50 |- | align="center"|8||1998|| Copenhagen|| || align="center"|8 || 25, 50 |- | align="center"|9||2000|| Pilsen|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|10||2004|| Munich|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|11||2008|| Plzeň|| || align="center"|10 || 25, 50, Running Target |- | align="center"|12||2012|| Bologna|| || align="center"|9 || 25, 50 |- | align="center"|13||2016|| Tallinn|| || align="center"|9 || 25, 50 |- |} ==Results== * http://www.issf- sports.org/competitions/historicalmedalwinners.ashx * http://www.issf- sports.org/competitions/results.ashx * https://results.sius.com/Championships.aspx * http://www.esc- shooting.org/documents/results/ * http://www.esc- shooting.org/documents/european_championships/ * http://www.the- sports.org/shooting-sports-european-shotgun-and-running-target- championships-2018-epr84349.html ==See also== *List of medalists at the European Shooting Championship ==References== *ISSF Results Overview Category:European youth sports competitions European Category:Shooting sports in Europe by country
